CatDescriptText: David L. Collins, taxi driver, Northside and Willis C. Anderson, retired, Watt Street, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, February 27, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe that labor unions, in general, are doing all they can to see that Negroes are not discriminated against in hiring and upgrading in employment?"  Mr. Collins' answer reads: "I imagine they are....Our union does."  Mr. Anderson's answer reads: "Yes they are.  But, it will take time before the whole situation is as good as it should be."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of David L. Collins wearing eyeglasses and dark suspenders, seated in taxicab; Portrait of Willis C. Anderson wearing eyeglasses, fedora, and overcoat, standing outside of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
